name: Hotel Ambient

reviews.title: great little hotel
reviews.text: Excellent three star hotel, had a duplex room with two TV's and a jacuzzi for 143 euro's a night, top floor rooms have a wonderful views across the city.

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: Ambient is certainly a good standard hotel for Romania. The rooms were very modern and spacious and the hotel itself would not have looked out of place in London or any European city.

reviews.title: Exceeded expectations
reviews.text: It's more of a business hotel than a tourist one however, and is expensive for the area. Breakfast was poor but other than that it was every inch a good three star hotel

We stayed at the Hotel Ambient based on the reviews here (reservation via email/website) and it certainly lived up to expectations. We had a 'matrimonial' double room, which came with a large modern bathroom and living space, a balcony, as well as a full length mirror on the ceiling above the bed! The hotel has secure underground parking & is only a five-minute walk to the square. The staff were friendly and helpful and recommended a great place, Bella Muzica (just off the square) for dinner. The food was great and very reasonably priced (3-course meal for 2 with two bottles of wine came to 30GBP!). It seemed quite popular and we were lucky to get a table, so book ahead! All in all, highly recommended.
reviews.title: Simply excellent!
Family run small hotel
reviews.text: We stayed in the Ambient one year ago. However, at that time, it wasn't listed with Tripadvisor at that time, and that's why our review is somewhat late.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just stayed here for three nights on a 10 day trip of Romania. I tried to check out some of the other hotels while we were there. Advantages of the Ambient - it is quite new - the 4* part is - the 3* part is older. I would definitely recommend staying in the 4* - especially if you are there in the summer as it has air conditioning. We took a business delux room with jacuzzi and it was very spacious and had a large bathroom. The weather turned very cold while we were there and we had to call down both nights and ask for the heat to be turned on - they had to call the "owner" to see if it was OK and then they turned it on for several hours - which worked fine. Also, this property has elevators - which if stairs is an issue - then this is the place for you. It is also very clean. The morning breakfast was OK - lots of local food - vegetables, etc. but filling. Our laptop worked great in the room.
reviews.title: Probably the best hotel in Brasov

reviews.text: Disadvantages would be that there is a ton of cigarette smoke in this town. We requested a non-smoking room - which we got and it did not smell like smoke - but the hallways smelled of smoke and if we opened our windows we could smell people smoking on their decks. Lots of smoke in the lobby.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is located very close to the heart of downtown - 5-7 minute walking distance. Laundry service was very good. We had dinner with another couple that were staying at the Casa Wagner - they liked it but they were in their late 60's and were on the third floor - no elevator - and the room was small. Also - it is located right on the town square and on the weekends a very loud band plays in the square until quite late at night which I think might be distracting.
reviews.title: Well located. Generous, comfortable room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is secure. I would stay here again because I think it is the best option - but 4* in Brasov is not 4* in Budapest. It is a totally different world.
reviews.title: Mirrors on the ceiling!
Great Hotel
reviews.text: 14 friends travelled to Brasov, and lodged at the Ambient. Great, clean and perfect hotel. Especially the staff at the reception were not only as truly helpful as can be, they also spoke very good English, and all that with a warm sense of humour. Nice big rooms, beds a bit hard, but acceptable. Excellent breakfast. Location fine for walking into old Brasov - 5 minutes walk. Guarded parking right on the doorstep. Would stay there again anytime.

Better directions would have been helpful, although when you find the Ambient, you know it! Well located on a corner, my sister and I also found it confusing to enter the hotel property. Our room was in the same area described by bumbling traveler (below) and was also confusing--many stairs and hallways, but was clean and nice and the bathroom was fantastic. We were just passing through Brasov and were tired so ate at the hotel restaurant. It was one of the best meals of the trip! We were pleased that a non-smoking section was available and our waiter, Madalin, was a really friendly and helpful guy. The food was plentiful and delicious. The breakfast buffet was also very good.
reviews.title: Confusing stay (in an okay way)

likes.liked: — The restaurant--food was great, service was even better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location relative to the historic town center, a bit too long to walk from train station. we were given a room in the top floor of an adjacent annex building -- no lift and one exit stair (fire trap!). I suspect this building was for staff housing, and the normal guestrooms were fully booked. Great breakfast buffet though! OK for a few days if you're passing through. There was a multi-lingual American guy working behind the front desk who was absolutely phenomenal and helpful -- he should be working at a 5-star hotel! Hotel is ok for a couple of days.

reviews.text: The hotel was brand new (part of it was still under construction at the time of my visit and was very reasonably priced. The modern design, including the glass elevator in reception was pleasing and clean. The room was enormous and the beds very comfortable. The reception staff were extremely friendly and helpful. They found a guide for me who took me to Bran Castle and we ended up buying him and his fiancé dinner in a authentic (meaning used by the locals) restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Modern Hotel squeezed inbetween old rustic buildings. Secure parking, a must in this place but thats another story. Clean, tidy place with helpful staff that all speak excellent english. Breakfast better than most and a 10 minute walk or £2 taxi ride gets you to where you need to be. These modern hotels all built within the last few years are the way to go in Romania, especially if your from the west. I would recommend this place. One negative and to be fair its not just this hotel it seems that all of them over here let people smoke in and all over the hotel. So the smoking ban has not reached Romania yet! This hotel seems aimed at western business so maybe it would get it all if it put in a fag ban?
reviews.title: A very good choice not exactly in the historic centre

reviews.text: I spent four nights at this hotel in early August and would highly recommend it to anyone wanting a good, solid if unspectacular hotel to use as a base for sightseeing this region. It is a short 10 minute walk to the pedestrian only section of Brasov which offers many outdoor restaurants and cafes and is busy with locals and tourists alike.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with friendly staff

likes.liked: — Friendly staff, good restaurant, good location
likes.disliked: — The baker on the next street does a delicious pain au chocolat!

reviews.text: The Ambient seems to have been built in stages as there are different sections visible from the street and I wound up in the newer section in a larger but spartan room on the fourth floor, room #403, which was a double bed with a view of a hill the hotel backs on to and offers mini-bar, large closet and bathroom with shower stall only. I often skipped the slow, small elevator to the fouth floor getting some exercise on the stairs again though anyone with mobility issues or who suffers from a touch of vertigo might want to wait for the elevator. The room itself was large but plain with a rock-hard bed and retro bedspread but the very pleasant surprise was the multitude of choices on the TV as there must have been 40+ channels with more than half being English-language choices such as Discovery Channel or BBC. While I don't usually spend lots of time watching TV while overseas, I did have a tougher time this trip with jet lag and so was usually awake for several hours each nite and having something on of interest was a nice thing for me. The mini-bar was only about twice the street price, which is a price I'm okay with paying for the convenience every now and then. I did stick to bottled water except for bushing my teeth but it is luckily quite cheap and plentiful both at the hotel and in Brasov shops as well.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

likes.disliked: — the view from teh lift is not as advertsied

reviews.text: The front-desk staff all spoke excellent English as do quite a lots of people in Brasov itself and Romania in general. I would recommend deciding soon after arrival what sights you want to see and how you want to see them as I left my decisions until about halfway through the stay and almost wound up with nothing tour-wise to take me to the nearby castles such as Bran or Peles Castles or Rasnov Fortress. Luckily, the staff acted on my behalf calling a local tour guides who made room for me for the next day tour of all three of these sights, which would've been much harder to see & do on my own. Bran Castle is the touristy, busy "Dracula" sight that really has next to nothing to do with the real Dracula and much more to do with separating tourists from their tourist dollars, but seeing it once as part of a full day tour was worth it to me. Rasnov Fortress and Peles Castle were both more interesting as almost all of Bran Castle has been rebuilt in the last 150 years and is far from the medieval sight lots of people expect. If you have limited time in Romania, I would highly recommend investing in a good guide book prior to leaving from your home and reading and studying the sights to get the most out of your stay.

reviews.title: Average at best
reviews.text: I stayed two nights at the Hotel Ambient on a tour of Romania. We were shown to our room. It had twin beds pushed together against a wall. The small window was a few feet away from the next building, with no view at all. I asked for a room where the beds were separated. I was shown the exact room one floor above. I asked, again, for a room where the beds were separated. At last, a room with the beds still together but in the center of a larger room, with a large window facing an old tiled roof. The shower was very small and leaked all over the floor.

reviews.title: Huge room, modern amenities, nice staff and breakfast

It was not right in the city center, but was convenient enough. They had a nice breakfast included each morning and the staff was friendly and accommodating.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ideally located between the old and new town. It is impossible not to notice the road. To the Old Town 5 minutes on foot.The room is comfortable and elegant and have been designed for relaxing. There are car parking (free for guests) and garage. There are very good restaurant. The breakfast are included in price. In our room (junior suite) were 2 gowns and slippers. There was double bed (very big), two armchairs and table, also there were TV, internet LAN (free), minibar (but not reasonable prices). In the bathroom with shower also in the bathroom was big and it has a window . Our room was cleaned every day. The staff is very friendly and complaisant.

Bed was about as comfortable as all the beds we slept on in Romania, very hard and felt the springs, but despite it's location in the centre of Brasov, had no noise problems etc.

reviews.text: Staff were very helpful at all times, particularly on the main desk, when asking about restaurants, sights, etc. Free internet in the bar area also.

reviews.text: It was a great base for exploring Transylvania with a car. I wouldn't recommend if you are arriving by train, it would take a long time to walk from the train station.
reviews.title: The best hotel in Brasov!

reviews.text: My only 'niggle' would be that the hotel is divided into a 3 star and a 4 star part - I can see why they are going down that road in terms of attracting different clients, however, when checking in, the member of staff on reception directed us to our room "you are in the 3 star part, I'm afraid there are lots of stairs to your room" and other things, which could have made others feel a little inadequate! Good options at breakfast, couldn't complain with that aspect of the hotel.
reviews.title: Nice rooms, very noisy

reviews.text: We were 5 person so we reserved 2 rooms for 2 nights, each one a 'deluxe' (4 star). When we arrived late and tired, we got a very basic room and I was very surprised. In the morning the receptionist (Sorin) - who was very nice and polite - changed our room to a one that was much better (a really 4 star room), but no refund was even given ...
reviews.title: What's 4 star about the Ambient?

description: Ideally located in the centre of Brasov, a few minutes away from the historic monuments, elegant bars and glamorous shops, this hotel is a reference point for luxury accommodation. Enjoy superb views of the city, perfect service and culinary delights in the hotel's restaurant. Utmost attention is paid to every single detail, ensuring that you spend an unforgettable stay at the Ambient hotel. Don't miss to explore the picturesque Old Town of Brasov with its mansions of the late Middle Ages and elegant 19th-century buildings.
